document.docAuthor: Couri, Marcia S., Pont, Adrian C. & Daugeron, Christophe

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Musca domestica Linnaeus, 1758: 596
. Syntypes ?sex, “in Europae domibus, etiam America”, not located, not in LSL (see
Pont, 1981: 168
).

Musca vicina
Macquart, 1851: 226
. Syntypes 2 males , 1 female , “ Amérique ” (actually Martinique ), in MNHNP (seen).

Musca flavifacies Bigot, 1888: 606
. Holotype female, “ Nouvelle-Calédonie ”, in BMNH (
Pont, 2000: 13–14
).

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Proepisternal depression with fine hairs; male eyes developed but not touching in middle; frontoorbital plates silver in male and densely golden in female; male abdominal tergite 1+2 yellow, at most with a brown median vitta. Male hypopygium as in Figs 25 , 30 and 35 ; male aedeagus with a small postgonite ( Fig 40 ), praegonite with 1 seta; epiphallus well developed weakly clubbed at tip (Fig. 45); female ovipositor long as in Figs 59 and 60 (all Figs in Pont, 1973a ).

Comments. The synonym
flavifacies Bigot
was described from New Caledonia , and the holotype was reviewed by Pont (2000) . Recorded from Bélep by Leboeuf (1914) ; from Nouméa and Isle of Pines by Williams (1943) ; from Nouméa by
Shinonaga et al . (1991)
. Redescription, comments on types, synonymies, details on geographic records and biology in Pont (1973a) .
